isis.stitle: International® MaxxForce™ 7 Engine Service Manual - Cylinder Head and Valve Train - Cleaning, Inspection, and Testing - Cylinder Head Inspection - Valves Removed

warning.para: To prevent personal injury or death, wear safety glasses with side shields. Limit compressed air pressure to 207 kPa (30 psi).

step1.para: Pressure testing the cylinder head reveals cracks in ports or sleeve leakage which cannot be seen using dye penetrant. Pressure test the cylinder head as follows:

figure.caption: Cylinder Head Pressure Test Plate ZTSE4534

calloutgroup.callout1: Pressure test regulator and gauge assembly
Cylinder Head Pressure Test Plate ZTSE4534

step1.para:
Fasten Cylinder Head Pressure Test Plate ZTSE4534
with rubber gasket attached to gasket side of cylinder head. Secure plate with ten M14 and five M8 mounting bolts.
Install pressure test regulator and gauge assembly to Cylinder Head Pressure Test Plate ZTSE4534 .
Immerse cylinder head in water. Apply air pressure and adjust to 124 to 138 kPa (18 to 20 psi) and inspect for leaks in the following places.
If leaks are observed, install a new cylinder head.
Clean all valve guides using a nylon brush, soap and water. Blow out any residue with filtered compressed air.
Position an inspection light at the bottom of the valve guide bores and examine the walls for burning or cracking. Replace cylinder head, if necessary.

figure.caption: Measurement of Small Hole Gauge (valve guide ID)

step1.para:
Measure each valve guide using a Valve Guide Gauge Tool ZTSE4577
and a 0-1 inch micrometer.

note.para: If valve guide inside diameter exceeds specifications , install a new cylinder head.

step1.para: Measure the valve guides within 0.64 mm (0.025 in) of each end and 90° from the crankshaft center line. Record the readings in order to determine the valve-to-guide running clearance.
Using valve guide inside diameter and valve stem diameter measurements, determine valve stem-to-guide running clearance. See Specifications . Replace valve if necessary.
Clean valve seat area using suitable solvent, before inspection.
Inspect exhaust valve seats for burned or cracked conditions. If any of these conditions exist, replace cylinder head.
Using a dial caliper, measure valve seat width. See Specifications . Replace cylinder head if necessary.
